title: Squeaksqueaksqueak
body:
"Are you sure this is going to work?" I ask my husband, reading the back of the mouse trap directions, frowning as I wonder if I even want it to work or not.

"Well, we have to do something!" He mutters, bending to push a mouse trap near one of the many fist sized holes hidden around the house.

The house is a two story building that had been constructed back in the 1900's. Like every old house, it's hard to plug up all the holes that have appeared over time. I haven't seen any mice yet, but I am finding tiny turds in the strangest places, as I move around the furniture. Thanks to Ratatouille, we all know how many rodents can dwell within a building.

We shut off the lights, and go into the bedroom, changing our clothes and quickly falling asleep. It isn't long before something makes me jerk awake.

Squeaking. Loud squeaking coming from right outside the bedroom door. I swing my legs out of bed and tip toe across the kitchen and lift my shaking hand to the light.

There's a freaking mouse in the trap!

"Honey!" I scream, as I reach over for the broom. My husband comes running out to see what I'm 'making a fuss about'.

He walks in while I bash the broom down, breaking the mouse trap, and releasing the paralyzed mouse. I shriek, as it scurries towards us, running past my feet. I hear the snap of another trap as the mouse manages to move remarkably quick for a thing with broken legs.

Another mouse is caught next to the large four inch gap in between the kitchen counter and the window. I gag and clutch my broom, staggering over to my husband.

The mouse in the trap squeaks furociously as it pulls itself towards us. It screams with every minuscule tug.

A dark shadow darts by. Then another. And another.

Mice start streaming out of the gap and screech uncontrollably, whacking every which way possible, as fast as I can gasp out my next breath. My vision was becoming spotted with white specks. I can hear my husband stomping beside me.

He stops stomping and puts his arms around me as I shake and cry uncontrollably. "What the hell was that?!" I cry against his shoulder.

My answer comes in the form of a thump behind the gap in the wall. I feel my eyes widen and I freeze in place. The mouse in the trap, still struggling to move, quickens the speed of it's disgusting twig like arms in panic.

From the gap, a long dark shadow slithers out and curls around the rodent, pulling it from the trap and pulling the critter through the gap. The crunching snap of it's back as it's pulled through the crack makes me vomit on the floor.

There's something in the walls, something that that mice have identified as a predator. We barely could afford the house a month ago, never mind traps.

"What are we going to do?"

My husband squeezes my arms. "We have to get it out. We have to break down the walls."
author: soverignkikikakes
